body:
Comment 2: 
> What's the drawback to including the source?

You cannot view the documentation without running the godoc. It's similar to the man
pages -> you can make the documentation part of --help, but it's a common and usefull
habit to have man page available by typing man <command>.

But this really doesn't have big priority -> another sollution would be to add an
support for generating NROFF output to godoc, so I can generate manpages from the
documentation.  The ability to have a documentation available without a browser would be
really nice (Or maybe I'm too oldschool:)).

BTW (maybe it was answered before somewhere) - what's the problem of including the
original Plan9 documentation for the tool-chain?  It's quite inconvenient to launch a
browser every time I need to search for an configuration option.
